item.value: initialize FetchTask right here
if any filters are present in the join tree, push them on top of the // table
Recurse over all the source tables
Recurse over the subqueries to fill the subquery part of the plan
Some initial checks for a query to see if we can look this query up in the results cache.

If we use CBO and we may apply masking/filtering policies, we create a copy of the ast. // The reason is that the generation of the operator tree may modify the initial ast, // but if we need to parse for a second time, we would like to parse the unmodified ast

Check query results cache. // If no masking/filtering required, then we can check the cache now, before // generating the operator tree and going through CBO. // Otherwise we have to wait until after the masking/filtering step
replace each of the position alias in ORDERBY with the actual column name, // if cbo is enabled, orderby position will be processed in genPlan
Gen OP Tree from resolved Parse Tree
fetch all the hints in qb

If we use CBO and we may apply masking/filtering policies, we create a copy of the ast. // The reason is that the generation of the operator tree may modify the initial ast, // but if we need to parse for a second time, we would like to parse the unmodified ast.

Check query results cache. // If no masking/filtering required, then we can check the cache now, before // generating the operator tree and going through CBO. // Otherwise we have to wait until after the masking/filtering step.

Check the 1st-level children and do simple semantic checks: 1) CTLT and * CTAS should not coexists. 2) CTLT or CTAS should not coexists with column * list (target table schema). 3) CTAS does not support partitioning (for * now).
if it is not CTAS, we don't need to go further and just return
step processPositionAlias out of genResolvedParseTree
analyze and process the position alias
replace each of the position alias in GROUPBY with the actual column name
change the location of position alias process here
Generate Resolved Parse tree from syntax tree
put accessed columns to readEntity
Generate column access stats if required - wait until column pruning
set ColumnAccessInfo for view column authorization
Perform Logical optimization
Generate table access stats if required
Take care of view creation
Generate Parse Context for Optimizer & Physical compiler
Deduce Resultset Schema
gen Resolved Parse Tree
Resolved Parse Tree
analyze create table command
Assumes one instance of this + single-threaded compilation for each query
allow partial partition specification for nonscan since noscan is fast.
validate the plan
A mapping from a tableName to a table object in metastore
for managed tables, make sure the file formats match
make sure the arguments make sense
Retrieve information about cache usage for the query.
Whether any error occurred during query compilation. Used for query lifetime hook
do the authorization check
Initialize the transaction manager. This must be done before analyze is called
save some info for webUI for use after plan is freed
command should be redacted to avoid to logging sensitive data
This enables substitution using syntax like ${var} ${system:var} and ${env:var}.
// Transaction manager used for the query. This will be set at compile time based on // either initTxnMgr or from the SessionState, in that order.
Resets taskID counter if true

deferClose indicates if the close/destroy should be deferred when the process has been // interrupted, it should be set to true if the compile is called within another method like // runInternal, which defers the close to the called in that method.
take a look to see if it is escaped
